title: robofleet-dashboard
description: Robofleet-dashboard is a web-based project built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS to visualize and interact with data from the Robofleet robotics platform. This dashboard provides a user-friendly interface to monitor robot status, track task progress, and analyze performance metrics, offering valuable insights for robotic systems management and optimization. Its focus centers on providing a clear and accessible overview of Robofleet data for improved robotic operations.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains a collection of Jupyter Notebooks and Python scripts focused on applying Python to various financial analysis and modeling tasks. It explores key project in finance using Python libraries, aiming to provide practical examples and tutorials for individuals interested in learning and implementing quantitative finance techniques.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the TeX source code and generated HTML for my resume. It serves as a personal project showcasing my skills and experience in a professional format. The resume is written in LaTeX for precise formatting and then converted to HTML for easy online accessibility and distribution.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. By tracking daily sleep schedules and comparing them to personalized sleep goals, this application provides insights into sleep patterns and offers a practical tool for improving sleep habits. The repository showcases TypeScript implementation for a front-end application focused on personal health and well-being.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a practical example of how to structure a complex web application using the Next.js framework, demonstrating features like server-side rendering, routing, and component-based architecture while providing a visually appealing and functional user interface suitable for various data management and visualization purposes.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript focused on [mention the project's main purpose, e.g., "creating a streamlined note-taking application" or "developing a robust data visualization tool"]. This repository contains the codebase for [mention key features or functionalities, e.g., "core application logic, user interface components, and API integrations"].  It serves as a [mention the project's status, e.g., "work-in-progress exploration" or "fully functional application"], demonstrating the implementation of [mention key technologies or design patterns, e.g., "modern web development practices" or "reactive programming principles"].

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project creating a customizable and interactive event calendar using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository provides a foundation for building a dynamic calendar component that can be easily integrated into web applications, allowing users to schedule, visualize, and manage events with a clean and user-friendly interface.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern, web-based IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. It utilizes Supabase for backend functionalities like data storage and authentication, enabling users to monitor and manage their assets in real-time. The project leverages TypeScript for type safety and employs modern JavaScript practices, showcasing a practical implementation of these technologies within the realm of IoT project development.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite.js, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide interactive and engaging AI-powered conversations. This project demonstrates how to integrate large language models into a modern web environment, exploring topics like server-side API development, client-side UI implementation with CSS, JavaScript, and HTML, and efficient front-end bundling.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a personal project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router) and TypeScript, showcasing a modern and responsive developer dashboard UI. It leverages Material-UI (MUI) for its component library, React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, and provides a clean and organized project structure for learning and inspiration related to building complex React applications.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a dynamic project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that serves as a digital canvas for brainstorming and organizing ideas. Leveraging modern web technologies, this application provides a user-friendly interface for capturing thoughts, connecting concepts, and visually structuring project plans, making it an ideal tool for personal or team-based idea generation and project management.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This GitHub repository contains a project focused on map visualization, leveraging HTML for the front-end interface and Python for data processing and potential backend functionality. It aims to provide interactive map-based visual representations and data exploration tools, offering insights from geographically referenced information. The project demonstrates skills in web development and data visualization techniques within a project-based learning environment.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a CRUD application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, utilizing HTML and CSS for the frontend and Shell scripting for deployment. This project explores fundamental web development concepts and database interactions, demonstrating a practical application of Python and web technologies for managing data. It covers topics such as CRUD operations, database connectivity, web framework implementation, and basic web design.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This project allows users to create and participate in polls, providing a real-time, interactive voting experience. It showcases modern web development practices and serves as a demonstration of project-based learning within the "project" topic category.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: Ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files, providing a user-friendly interface to efficiently debug and understand robot behavior. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripts, this project aims to improve ROS development workflows by offering powerful log filtering, visualization, and analysis capabilities.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, exploring [mention the project's core functionality or purpose based on the README, e.g., interactive map visualizations, data analysis dashboards, etc.]. This repository showcases development practices using modern web technologies and provides a foundation for further exploration in [mention relevant topics based on the project, e.g., data visualization, front-end development, interactive web applications].

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-seller is a modern e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 and TypeScript, leveraging the power of React Query for efficient data fetching and MUI for a sleek and responsive user interface. Designed using the Pages Router, this project demonstrates a practical implementation of type-safe front-end development principles for online marketplaces, encompassing topics such as product display, shopping cart functionality, and checkout processes.
